prompt: <description>**Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Curved Bottom Edge** *Shape description:* A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly curved bottom edge. The prism is centered on a white background. *Dimensions:* - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.2805 - Height: 0.75 *Construction instructions:* 1. **Create a new coordinate system.** The euler angles are [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector is [0.0, 0.2805, 0.0]. 2. **Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system.** This sketch will form the profile of the prism. 3. **Draw the following lines to create the bottom edge of the prism:** - Line 1: Start at [0.0, 0.0724]; end at [0.002, 0.0]. - Line 2: Start at [0.002, 0.0]; end at [0.75, 0.0]. - Line 3: Start at [0.75, 0.0]; end at [0.75, 0.0623]. - Line 4: Start at [0.75, 0.0623]; end at [0.5942, 0.0623]. - Line 5: Start at [0.5942, 0.0623]; end at [0.5942, 0.2182]. - Line 6: Start at [0.5942, 0.2182]; end at [0.5318, 0.2182]. - Line 7: Start at [0.5318, 0.2182]; end at [0.2203, 0.2182]. - Line 8: Start at [0.2203, 0.2182]; end at [0.1579, 0.2182]. - Line 9: Start at [0.1579, 0.2182]; end at [0.1579, 0.0724]. - Line 10: Start at [0.1579, 0.0724]; end at [0.1558, 0.0724]. - Line 11: Start at [0.1558, 0.0724]; end at [0.0, 0.0724]. 4. **Draw the following arc to create the curved part of the bottom edge:** - Arc 1: Start at [0.5318, 0.2182]; mid point at [0.376, 0.0662]; end at [0.2203, 0.2182]. 5. **Close the loop by connecting the endpoints of Line 1 and Arc 1.** 6. **Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75.** 7. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system.** 8. **Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis to a depth of 0.2805 units.** This will create the 3D model of the prism. 9. **Create a new solid body with the extruded sketch as the base feature.** No boolean operation is needed for this part, so set the 'operation' field to 'NewBodyFeatureOperation'.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Construction of a Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom as the first part of the final shape. Begin by creating a new coordinate system using the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Now, create a sketch on the X-Y plane with the following components and constraints: * Face 1 contains Loop 1, which consists of: + Line 1 with Start Point at [0.0, 0.0] and End Point at [0.4375, 0.0] + Line 2 with Start Point at [0.4375, 0.0] and End Point at [0.4375, 0.75] + Line 3 with Start Point at [0.4375, 0.75] and End Point at [0.0, 0.75] + Line 4 with Start Point at [0.0, 0.75] and End Point at [0.0, 0.0] Loop 1 is a closed loop consisting of four line segments. For scaling purposes, use a scaling factor of 0.75. Now, extrude the sketch by 0.0037 units in the positive Z direction and 0.0 units in the negative Z direction with the "NewBodyFeatureOperation" operation. Part 2: Construction of a Cylindrical Object with a Smaller Cylindrical Hole in the Center Construct a cylindrical object with a smaller cylindrical hole in the center as the second part of the final shape. Begin by creating a new coordinate system using the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.325, 0.225, 0.0037] Now, create two sketches: * Sketch on Face 1: + Loop 1 contains: - Circle 1 with Center at [0.0063, 0.0063] and Radius 0.0062 * Sketch on Face 2: + Loop 1 contains: - Circle 1 with Center at [0.0687, 0.0063] and Radius 0.0062 For scaling purposes, use a scaling factor of 0.075. Now, extrude the sketches by 0.0 units in the positive Z direction and 0.0037 units in the negative Z direction with the "CutFeatureOperation" operation.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Flat Top and Bottom and a Curved Side Step 1: Create the Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin (0, 0, 0) with no rotation. Step 2: Draw the 2D Sketch For this part, create a new sketch on the X-Y plane (face_1) of the coordinate system. Step 3: Create the Loops and Curves In this part, there are two loops - loop_1 and loop_2 - and four curves - line_1, arc_1, line_2, and arc_2 - that make up the loops. * **loop_1** is made up of two lines (line_1 and line_2) and two arcs (arc_1 and arc_2). + **line_1** starts at (0.1359, 0) and ends at (0.6141, 0). + **arc_1** starts at (0.6141, 0), has a midpoint at (0.75, 0.1359), and ends at (0.6141, 0.2718). + **line_2** starts at (0.6141, 0.2718) and ends at (0.1359, 0.2718). + **arc_2** starts at (0.1359, 0.2718), has a midpoint at (0.0, 0.1359), and ends at (0.1359, 0).0). * **loop_2** is not explicitly defined in the JSON, but since the object has a flat top and bottom, there should be a second loop with a single curve - a circle (circle_1) - representing the top surface of the object. + **circle_1** should have its center at (0.425, 0.2135) - the midpoint of line_1 and line_2 - and a radius of 0.1717 (half the length of line_1 or line_2). Also, note that all curves form closed loops. Step 4: Apply Constraints Ensure all lines and arcs are properly connected (tangent or perpendicular) to form the desired shape. Step 5: Define the Sketch Scale Apply a scaling factor of 0.75 to the sketch to adjust its size. Step 6: Perform Extrusion Extrude the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D model with a depth of 0.2471 units along the Z-axis. The description says the height of the part should be approximately 0.247 units, but to match the final shape's height, set the extrude depth to 0.2471 units. Step 7: Describe the Part The part features a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side, having a rectangular opening on the side. Its dimensions are approximately 10 units in height and 5 units in width. The opening on the side is 2 units wide and 3 units tall. The object is centered in the image. The length of the part is 0.75 units, the width is also 0.75 units, and the height, when including the extrusion, is 0.2471 units. Please follow these instructions to complete Part 1, then proceed with Part 2 if there are more parts. The instructions provided are based on the JSON and should allow the junior CAD designer to create an accurate CAD model.</description>
